Class FSM_API.Interaction.FSMTimers

Provides a simple, static utility for managing named timers based on elapsed float time (e.g., seconds) and integer increments (e.g., frames or discrete steps).

This class is designed to be time-agnostic; it does not acquire time itself but relies on the calling application to provide delta time (dt) and delta integer (di) values. It serves as a convenience for implementing frequency-based updates or delays, complementing the FSM API's core, untimed step mechanism.

Namespace: TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API
Assembly: FSM_API.dll
Syntax
public static class FSM_API.Interaction.FSMTimers
Remarks

Users are responsible for integrating UpdateTimers into their application's main loop and for providing accurate time deltas. Timers must be manually added and checked for expiration.

FloatTimers

Gets a dictionary of float-based timers, keyed by a string name. These timers are typically used for time-based delays or frequencies (e.g., seconds).

Resets a specific float timer to its setPoint value. If the timer does not exist, no action is taken.

| Edit this page View Source

UpdateTimers(float, int)

Updates all registered float and integer timers by subtracting the provided delta values.

Declaration
public static void UpdateTimers(float dt, int di)
Parameters
Type Name Description
float dt

The delta float time (e.g., seconds since last update) to subtract from float timers.
int di

The delta integer (e.g., frames since last update) to subtract from integer timers.
Remarks

This method simply decrements all active timers. It does not check if timers have reached zero or perform any actions based on timer expiration. It is up to the calling code to query individual timers (e.g., FSMTimers.FloatTimers["MyTimer"] <= 0f) and trigger relevant FSM updates or other logic.
